questions.question: The Progressive Era is defined as a historical era because the time period is characterized by—

choices.answer: Shrinking of the U.S. industrial economy
Growing support for overseas expansion
Shifting attitudes about civil rights for minorities
Changing ideas about the functions of U.S. government

questions.question: The reform movements of the Progressive Era generally focused on —

choices.answer: Civil rights for minority groups.
Policies related to isolationism.
Issues related to social justice.
Concerns about conservationism.

questions.question: Political change in the Progressive Era was characterized by the expansion of —

choices.answer: Social welfare programs.
Power for the executive branch.
Individual rights for more Americans.
Civil rights for American Indian tribes.

questions.question: Which list of Progressive Era presidents is in the correct chronological order?

choices.answer: 1) Woodrow Wilson  2) Teddy Roosevelt  3) Howard Taft
1) Howard Taft  2) Woodrow Wilson  3) Teddy Roosevelt
1) Teddy Roosevelt  2) Howard Taft  3) Woodrow Wilson
1) Woodrow Wilson  2) Howard Taft  3) Teddy Roosevelt

questions.question: How did the 17th Amendment give more political power to the individual voter?

choices.answer: Allowed citizens to vote regardless of race/creed/ethnicity.
Established the direct election of Senators by popular vote.
Freed citizens to vote w/o a poll tax or literacy test.
Allowed for the # of senators per state to be by population.

questions.question: As a result of the Progressive Era reforms listed —

choices.answer: Citizens became more involved in the election process
Corporate leaders began campaigning for elected office
Political bosses gained greater control over local elections
Big business came under additional government regulation

questions.question: What was an effect of Progressive Era political reforms of initiative, referendum, and recall?

choices.answer: Judicial authority expanding to include give local elections
Government officials respond to the needs of voters quicker
Women/minorities increase participation in political process
Political machines gain influence in local election/politics

questions.question: The writings of W.E.B. DuBois promoted the idea that —

choices.answer: African Americans deserved racial equality immediately
African Americans needed to organize as a political party
African Americans must leave the country to obtain rights
African Americans should seek to gradually gain civil rights

questions.question: Journalist and social reformer Ida B. Wells was responsible for exposing the brutality of —

choices.answer: Lynching
Gambling
Child Labor
Alcohol Abuse

questions.question: The American public and President Roosevelt responded to the excerpt by —

choices.answer: Advocating for reforms to working conditions
Demanding better school nutrition programs
Calling for the regulation of the food industry
Working for the passage of the Sixteenth Amendment

questions.question: Based on the chart, the creation of the Progressive Party affected the 1912 election by?

choices.answer: Proved that a Progressive Party candidate could win.
Contributed to a Democratic win by splitting the Republicans
Forced Democrats to adopt issues that Progressives supported
Progressives won popular vote but notthe election.

questions.question: Whichgovernmental policy was a direct result of the event described?

choices.answer: Education programs were created to study geography/climate
There were effortsto annex Alaska by the President/Congress
Millionsof acres were set aside as public property/parks
Grants of money were given to conservation agencies.

questions.question: Based on the chart, which best describes the relationship between federal govt and business?

choices.answer: Federal govt. created mandated protections for businesses.
Federal govt. gave funding to further business development.
Federal govt. took part in regulating business practices.
Federal govt passed laws improving working conditions.

questions.question: The first large-scale effort by the U.S. government to regulate business involved —

choices.answer: Passage of the Sherman Anti-trust Act
Adoption of the Eighteenth Amendment
Creation of the Food and Drug Administration
Establishment of the Interstate Commerce Commission

questions.question: Federal Reserve Act of 1913 created a central banking system with the responsibility of —

choices.answer: Collecting of federal income taxes
Managing of interstate commerce
Enforcing of the Sherman Anti-trust legislation
Regulating of monetary policy in the U.S.

questions.question: Efforts during the Progressive Era to gain the right to vote for women included —

choices.answer: Filing lawsuits with the Supreme Court
Strikes and lobbying federal legislators
Boycotts and conducting public referendums
Public protests and amending the Constitution

questions.question: How did the actions of Progressive reformers reflect the stated goal expressed in the excerpt?

choices.answer: Reformers participated in the democratic process to change
Reformers inspired others to support them by using the press
Reform supported causes that exemplified the majority will
Reformers consisted of various racial and ethnic groups

questions.question: The excerpt reflects prominent social concerns because the subject matter dealt with the —

choices.answer: Horrible conditions many workers faced.
Pathetic quality of housing in many cities.
Inequalities between the rich and the poor.
Lack of social services available at the time.

questions.question: W.E.B. DuBois and other prominent Progressive leaders founded the—

choices.answer: Freedman's Journal
United Negro Alliance
League of United African American Voters
National Association for the Advancement of Colored People

questions.question: Jane Addams is best remembered for —

choices.answer: Writing muckraking articles inspiring social reform
Creating social reform programs for the urban poor
Leading the temperance movement during the early 1900s
Serving as the first woman representative during the 1800s

questions.question: Frances Willard’s efforts as a Progressive reformer included —

choices.answer: Building settlement houses
Promoting rights for workers
Founding the first college for women
Expanding the temperance movement

questions.question: How did the introduction of electricity affect the workplace in the U.S.?

choices.answer: Businesses relocated to suburban areas.
Factories were able to open late into the night.
Cottage industries expanded into more homes.
Assembly lines were able to move more quickly.

questions.question: Building subway systems in American cities early in the 20th century contributed to—

choices.answer: Faster access to information for Americans
Decline in the standard of living for Americans
Greater employment opportunities for Americans
Increase in issues related to crime for Americans
